title: The Midnight Visitor
author: Sarah Blake
content: I never should have answered the door that night. The knocking started at exactly midnight - three sharp raps that echoed through my empty house. I thought it was strange, given that I lived miles from my nearest neighbor, but I convinced myself it must be someone in need of help.

As I approached the door, the temperature seemed to drop with each step. The brass doorknob felt like ice against my palm. When I finally worked up the courage to open it, what I saw made my blood run cold.
There, illuminated by the pale moonlight, stood a figure wearing my face.
